question_stem.en: A 28-year-old woman at 20 weeks gestation comes to the office for her first prenatal appointment. An ultrasound is performed, during which the fetus is found to have a congenital defect and no cardiac activity. Due to the pregnancy loss, the patient undergoes an induction of labor. After delivery, gross pathology of the fetus is shown in the exhibit {{exhibit_1}}. These findings are most likely due to an impairment in which of the following embryologic processes?
question_stem.zh: 一名28岁的孕妇，孕20周，来诊所进行首次产前检查。进行超声检查时，发现胎儿有先天缺陷且无心脏活动。由于妊娠丢失，患者接受了引产。分娩后，胎儿的肉眼病理表现见{{exhibit_1}}。这些发现最可能由于以下哪种胚胎学过程的损伤所致？

question.en: These findings are most likely due to an impairment in which of the following embryologic processes?
question.zh: 这些发现最可能由于以下哪种胚胎学过程的损伤所致？

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of neural tube defects, specifically anencephaly, and the embryologic process of rostral neuropore closure. It requires recognizing the gross pathology of anencephaly and linking it to the failure of the anterior neuropore to close during fetal development. 

To solve this question, identify the key finding of anencephaly (absence of brain and skull) and associate it with the embryologic process of rostral neuropore closure. Rule out other options by understanding the embryologic origins and associated defects of neural crest cells, notochord, prosencephalon, and vertebral column.
summary.zh:
本题考察对神经管缺陷的知识，特别是无脑畸形，以及头端神经孔闭合的胚胎学过程。它需要识别无脑畸形的肉眼病理表现，并将其与胎儿发育过程中前神经孔闭合的失败联系起来。

要解决这个问题，需要确定无脑畸形的关键发现（无脑和颅骨），并将其与头端神经孔闭合的胚胎学过程联系起来。通过了解神经嵴细胞、脊索、前脑和椎柱的胚胎学起源和相关缺陷，排除其他选项。

tags: Anencephaly; Neural tube defects; Embryology; Rostral neuropore closure; Primary neurulation; Congenital anomalies; Fetal development
